l8kEq2uwqqMW-QeAQ8h8mg.text: Wonderful brunch venue right next to South Kensington station.The menu is great with a decent selection of dishes that should please most people. The decor is characterful and the service from the staff is great even during busy times!

WKXh5UDCEyeTwUpXC1DU2Q.text: Muriel's Kitchen is a nice little oasis in the hustle and bustle of South Kensington station. I think the reason I like this place is it reminds me of a place I could find back in California. (Mostly) healthy, fresh food that emphasizes seasonal ingredients at reasonable prices. Their salad box makes a healthy filling lunch and comes in at £5. You should also try the Miso salmon, which is delicious! My friend thoroughly enjoyed their veggie curry, which was lighter than a typical curry, but packed in just as great flavor.The service here is great - I have gotten both takeout from here as well as dined in. The staff is attentive and helpful, but I can see that at busier times the service could likely fall off a bit. The decor and ambiance when not overly crowded is great. You honestly feel like you're in someone's dining room. I'd say if you're in the area and in the mood for a solid meal that is on the healthier side, this is one of the better choices in the area.

66YZ3q1Jt5vCPbJD7GnLhg.text: A convenient location in S. Kensington and defeats indecision when selecting a restaurant. However,  I was very dismayed about the menu selection and meal preparation method. I ordered the lasagna and a side of sliced potatoes, only to discover that my food was not freshly prepared. In fact, it seemed that it was reheated in the microwave quite possibly.  Whether it be the oven or microwave, it still repulses me that this overpriced restaurant doesn't have the sense to prepare fresh food and actually preps it in advance as it gets stored in their display case for who knows what period of time! Luckily,  this restaurant occupies a prime location next to the tube and attracts starved passerbys. Otherwise, I doubt anyone would bother paying such a premium on 'reheated' food!  Go elsewhere if in the area!

UEN3pmcqyyofdQw5ds2UoQ.text: Loved. This. Place. Excellent service and the food was outstanding. Their breakfast tea service brought back many happy memories of a previous trip to England, and the croissants were very tasty. Decor is charming...this is a happy place! If you're ever in the area, give it a try!

FA2u_C4K2G20f5gtTR3EJA.text: Small, but really good food. We had an awesome smoked salmon benedict, yogurt and granola, and very good coffee. We came back the next day for the bread pudding was also really good.

77sYelqmzgSGe--1BOveRQ.text: Just popped in here to get a dessert to go... and they were all AMAZING! Wanted to go back the next day! Got a mini lemon meringue tart! TO DYE FOR! SOOOOO delicious!  We still talk about it and its been a few months!

kbrLV791m-YBmGGwnc3KuA.text: I was a little skeptical because all the food is out for you to see and they heat it up, if necessary, in the microwave once you order it. I thought it was cafeteria style but if you are dining in, they will seat you and give you a menu to order from. The staff is very friendly and helpful if you have any questions about the menu. We ordered:Famous Beef Lasagna - YUM! Big portion and flavorful. Lamb, Feta and Mixed Herbs w/Spicy Fenugreek Yoghurt - This was like a meatball. It was a delicious combination of herbs and dipping it into the yoghurt was perfect.Char-grilled Salmon w/Tomato, Onion, Chilli and Coriander Relish - The salmon was a typical grilled salmon. The standout in this dish was the coriander relish, that was really good.Mixed Green Beans and Courgette w/Truffle Oil, Dill and Tarragon - The amount of truffle oil was light and the beans were cooked perfectly.Roasted Aubergine w/Wild Garlic Yoghurt, Tomato, Red Onion and Chilli - My FAVORITE dish here! It was a creamy eggplant that may not look very appetizing but tasted incredible. I would come back for this dish.We ordered and ate family style which I recommend because you get to try more things. There were a lot of desserts there too but we were too full to try any. Great location right next to the tube station and super close to the bus stops.

TcF4ugQESkYVhoHUkRe_7A.text: Run, don't walk to Muriel's Kitchen! It was just renovated which gives it a much homier atmosphere. The food is amazing. Home- cooked Italian food in the middle of South Kensington. The service is a bit lacking, but that gets overlooked for the food.

VIeH0MC2_Rp42wRriIusqQ.text: The food might be decent but this has got to be the most poorly organised and inefficient restaurant I've been to (and that includes restaurants in Pakistan, which can be quite inefficient!). The waitresses had no idea what was going on, the queue is all over the place, staff are running around shouting stuff at each other, the tables are positioned in a very haphazard manner. Never going back!

9vHxsQ2P0FflNyeW5y1q1g.text: Gluten free bread is available. For salads and soup, one must get there after 11 am. (Or 10:50 to avoid long line) It's not vegan friendly otherwise. Morning menus are very egg heavy. Filled croissant I ordered was disappointing. I was expecting more greens but there were hardly any. Although quite pricy (compared to Chicago) for the size, they have freshly made green juices and green smoothies. I asked for strong ginger and they were able to serve good gingery juice. (Thank you!)It was very small place packed with people. All the staffs were nice and attentive. I will come again and try something different next time.

XnZ9VitMTcyidslO924Dag.text: Popped in here for cake and coffee due to the enticing cake selection on display in the window... was not disappointed! The coffee was excellent and the chocolate bread and butter pudding slice was to die for. Boyfriend's banoffee cupcake was delicious too. We didn't try the mains, but I had a sneaky peek at the diners next to us and their food looked pretty amazing. The cafe itself is pretty small and cramped - wouldn't be good for big groups. I do wonder how disabled access would work too... The decor's lovely though and the service was ok if a little slow.If I fancy a cake in South Ken again, I'll be back.

LPeym6-4a6YkYPqRfOujPA.text: I came here with a couple of friends for a light snack to hold us over while roaming the Streets of London.  Some of us were hungrier than other, and Muriel's seems to be a good option to satisfy everyone no matter what their appetite.  i ordered a strawberry sponge cake which was just the right texture and had just the right amount of fresh strawberries.  Also, my friend was raving about some type of little custard tarte that she got, and their prices seemed reasonable too.  I also really like the decor of the place which was kinda unique and fun.  Also, be sure to use the bathroom as there is plenty to look at even in there!

ThBO8-7aJsMe0xgAq99XSQ.text: Muriel is a great little place right next to the South Kensington tube station. Order a selection of its salads (or pastries if you are in the mood) and sit by the window for a little bit of people watching.

t5WWcpVshIwMKeR6U9mniA.text: This place had our favorite breakfast food so far in London. I had Eggs Royale with Bubble n Squeak and it was incredible. Our only critique was it was very very loud in there at the time we visited, lots of loud girls in a small acoustically unsound space. nothing really to be done in that case, it was still totally yummy and we'll definitely be going back!

M0y3hz6YPamFn6gPeRlupA.text: A friend and I had bought some cheap boot camp classes in Hyde park from Groupon. We wandered around the park in the dimming light and could not find the class; to be fair the instructions told us to walk north-east and we didn't have a compass.We gave up walking around the park as we had already wasted 35 minutes of an hour class and stumbled across Muriel's kitchen.Our frostbitten fingers were more than happy to walk into this toasty and cake filled wonderland.We ate cake, I had a coffee and my friend had a pink lemonade. The cake was phenomenal and everything was to kitsch and cute we stayed longer than we needed to.A highlight was the super friendly waitress with probably the most impeccable skin I've seen in a long time (it must be the cake I told myself).The little details made it for me; such as hanging our coats on repurposed forks and the fact the flower pots dangled from the ceiling.We sat in the window and people watched, its right on a corner so we had plenty of things to look at.Muriel's kitchen, at that time, was a cosy oasis in a horrible evening and really redeemed our desperate lost wanderings through a freezing park.

xkDQFW2dI-rQnAvfUiVuUQ.text: Really cute looking place and friendly staff. Good cappuccino and carrot cake. The food was as expected. The huge meatballs that I got was just that - Huge balls of meat. Pretty dry and nothing special about them, nothing at all. Go here to enjoy a coffee and the friendly atmosphere, but don't expect anything magical about the food.

fCdJYg_t1dXN1fFRreWO5g.text: My cousin and I ordered a croissant and cappuccino. My croissant was actually a sandwich with artichoke, prosciutto, and mozzarella. OMG!! It was to die for!! My other cousin's girlfriend ordered blueberry pancakes, which were just as delicious. But the favorite dish was my cousins's ham, cheese and spinach omelette!!!  My sister ordered Muriel's breakfast sandwich, which has bacon, tomato, spinach, and mozzarella.  It too was delicious.  This is our third breakfast in London and so far, it has been the best and our favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The favorite dish of our morning: an omelette with tomatoes, spinach, ham and cheese.
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. You can get your food for take out.

57M361lPl6ow26Za1Sfltg.text: I was hoping for better food given their tempting desserts and fresh veggies and salads in the window. I sat down and proceeded to have a very "blah" lunch. Roasted carrots and lentils that had absolutely no flavor (no herbs, salt, pepper) and a chicken cutlet served over dry arugula (non dressed). The chicken tasted like it was reheated in a microwave - tough and thick, impossible to cut, and also flavorless. I asked for some dressing to put on it but really this place left me disappointed. Lunch was about $30 and just really fell flat for me, unfortunately.

WIcRG5zLDzpHg64V4cxl6g.text: After several days of traipsing around London back in Oct. 2012, this was the perfect "last dinner in London" place for us. Casual atmosphere with impeccable service and not to mention, absolutely incredibly yummy food. Just a walk down the street from the Regency Hotel, if you're staying in the area. Yes, this place is cozy but don't let that deter you. My girl friends and I still had a fabulous time. Definitely a must for any fellow foodie!

tmJyivhShmKZETVs4lgjnA.text: Went for Sunday brunch and got amazing food at a good pace and a good price!Not too expensive and late mocha was delicious!

5sJ8FgK3hSJ_pPO-8LbwwA.text: Great deserts!  A nice place to have a coffee and a cake or dessert.  They have hot dishes too.  Very full restaurant which some people may not like.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Brownie sandwich with Dulce de leche inside served hot, and vanilla ice-cream.
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Best brownie I have eaten in London, with Dulce de Leche inside.  My brother and I shared as the portion is very large.

HnCM79sxXukpdvTtUaPVJA.text: Just took takeaway, no sooner that I got home, there were 2 fraudulent transactions on my account (and an attempt of a third).I noticed most cafes/retailers in the UK require you to insert your own card into the reader (we are tourists), but the person at the counter swiped the card out of sight.I think they may have a fraud problem, and would encourage people to be very careful there if not paying with cash.Now I have to reset my card, and spent an hour on the phone w fraud dept. while on vacation. I would give negative stars if possible.

BgtLSWKBy-rLDptlnpFjDg.text: Had brunch here once. Decided not to repeat it.Definitely not because it wasn't good, it was lovely. Good food, good staff. Too many noisy people for my taste, at noon. Probably a sign of a hot spot.

DBZxyDmxkZClGS6Y9dPXKA.text: lovely! this place has a very calming aesthetic and color choices, it is small and the menu is as well but they have a large variety-also for vegans/vegetarians! we have the veggie burger, avo toast, smoothie and soup of the day with a salad. all was delicious and healthy and filling.

1QfxYXh4Q81-ZhbutzMyIQ.text: Had proper English Tea and it was delightful. We had made a reservation which I would recommend since it seems to be a very popular place.  Service was the best ! The food was delicious!  Next time we are in London we will be visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. English Tea

2k4mbT4tfTtVXfWc9vE-Iw.text: Popped in here to refuel after a good amount of sight-seeing earlier in the day. I think this may be a small chain of restaurants.  I noticed another location around London a few days later.  The decor is exactly how I would like my summer cottage to be decorated (Yes- that's right. The one that doesn't exist). The service was extremely pleasant and they had wi-fi so I was able to chill for a bit after my meal without feeling rushed.I had the BBQ sliders with pickled cabbage which were the cutest little tastiest treats.  They were packed with delicious pork and sauce that were enough to leave you satiated and not feeling heavy after.  A side of fries on the side made for a pleasant lunch.  I think people flock here for their brunches and I can see how the atmosphere would lend itself to a really awesome weekend meet up with family and friends.

NqU9QsYSY9_V07iTKIP3Cw.text: Sardines salivate over sandwiches If I was reviewing this place on its food alone then it would be five star, hands down. Unfortunately other elements let it down, but still solid steel four star!So let's start with the negatives, and don't focus on them too much. 1. Tables are too tight, it's like breakfast in a restaurant for incredibly skinny short people, and because it is so popular you are crammed in there like the proverbial sardine!2. The host on the day was an overly enthusiastic French lady who was just a bit too IN YOUR FACE. Which is annoying when you are still waking up and are very very hungry.That's it really, now for the good stuff. orange .juice which tastes as if it was squeezed by fruity cherubs, and incredibly tasty strong coffee. I ordered the breakfast sandwich, including bacon, spinach, tomato, avocado, fried or scrambled eggs and some of the most amazing cheddar cheese I have ever tasted. I had my eggs scrambled, and they didn't hold back, and the bread is whole meal, but not overly toasted so the edges don't cut the roof of your mouth. I needed some ketchup also, and they had some gourmet stuff which blew my mind. Seriously this food is damn near perfect, and I want to go back and marry that sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast sandwich - amazing

72pTIM034jE-h2twEc_A-g.text: This is an adorable spot for brunch. My pancakes were very excellent, if a little different from what I expected (thicker than a typical American pancake) and the bacon was even better. My partner loved his full English as well.

Bn2pVTUnI0my-DNo_YsE3g.text: I walked into Muriel's kitchen after taking a look at the gorgeous blueberry pancakes through the window, and I was not disappointed! The pancakes, while a large helping, were delicious, soft, sweet, and had just the right amount of blueberries. The berry muesli was also quite good. My one complaint is that I ordered an apple juice only to receive a pear juice, which was tasty but not what I ordered. I would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry pancakes!

6FqtNlwV0JPd9IC7xBWlfg.text: Only called in for a quick drink but have to say I would recommend the hot vanilla apple juice I started out unsure about the idea but it's like hot apple pie with ice cream in liquid form. Very nice.

Xs-m8sfA9INVV-6_sDzK8g.text: The ambiance at Muriel's is perfect for brunch! They had delicious looking pastries and lunch items displayed at the front but we got the eggs florentine, eggs royale and two Americanos. Being from San Francisco, we are a bit picky about coffee and like it filtered, large, and very hot, so the lukewarm and very small Americanos lost a star for this place. The staff was efficient and friendly and the decor is really cute. The eggs were tasty but really different than in America- they were cooked a bit longer and the yolks were orange!

i-ZEjMmrsG7XvKExN06c0Q.text: This place is lovely, easy to pop to when your tired out from a day at the museums before hopping on the tube round the corner.The Decor is great with lots of little touches that make it a proper 'kitchen' lights made from colanders, coat hooks from bent serving cutlery, tea cup and saucers decorating the wall and herbs to add some plant life (like my kitchen at home). The drinks and cakes were just astonishingly good. I had a freshly squeezed apply juice - not too sure how this is possible but it tastes like you are eating an apple - worth a try any day of the week.The four varieties of cakes we sampled (there were four us not a greedy two!) were delicious. Light and airy or thick and flavoursome. A great find I will be encouraging others to visit. Although it is not cheap...

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

o5W-9YNth2J_YmzOqanZRA.text: Loved the ambiance of this little restaurant from the outside and the yummy looking counter top displays (it reminded us of Joan's on 3rd at home in Los Angeles).Stopped here for an early dinner on our last night in the UK. The restaurant is pretty small but quaint. There are three communal counter style seating areas and a small section of tables and booths (perhaps 10-12?) in the rear.The food is pre-made but fresh and displayed in a beautiful array at the front entry. After you make your selections they're heated up and brought to your table.When I spied it on the menu I knew I had to try the Cauliflower with saffron & parmesan soup! (Ever since having this delicious concoction at James' Beach in Venice, CA, I always keep an eye out for it.) The bowl was a more than generous amount, however, the soup was extremely bland. You could taste a bare hint of saffron but absolutely no parm. I added a heavy dose of salt and pepper which helped, but not much as those truly needed to be added during the cooking process. Needless to say, I was pretty disappointed. It wasn't terrible, just not great.  For my main dish I chose the Chargrilled Salmon with caper and dill mayo. This dish redeemed the lackluster soup. Deliciously moist grilled salmon flaky and cooked perfectly served with a side of caper and dill mayo. I'm not normally a fan of mayos and mayo type sauces but this one was not too heavy and had a great vinegary tang from the capers and a freshness from the dill that complemented the salmon nicely.The service was efficient and prompt, but not the most personable. The overall ambiance of the restaurant and the salmon dish kept this a 3 star, the meh soup and "cold" service perhaps a 2.5. If I lived in the area would I come here again? Yes. The food was good, just need a few more smiles.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chargrilled salmon with caper and dill mayo.
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Bread basket (extra 2.50)
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Cauliflower, parmesan and saffron soup

x8s6sSbXseoDWt1u6jJ0Zw.text: The traditional holiday dinner - the one with the meatballs, potato, and veggies - was delicious and the mulled wine was yummy.  I'd return, for sure!

kQvOFTxU3eR1SNlrsKfT_w.text: I agree with Rich M on most points (except the food, it's atrocious):It's too squashy to fit your handbag and yourself, and don't think you can't dare a private conversation with your lover.The food is abominable. It's wrong for them to charge.The coffee is the worst. Worse than American.The service is nitty picky as if they are holding seats for Queen Elizabeth herself. As if anyone actually wants to be there in the first place.Memorial to Bad Kitchens is one of the biggest reasons I've stopped staying at Number 16 (hotel) when I'm in London. I need a variety of great breakfast restaurants/cages, and this seems like the one that took it all away.

kGZ3BX_8fE9MqGxRzJQCDg.text: I took my boyfriend for a birthday breakfast here before we went to the Victoria and Albert museum. It was really busy at 11am on a Saturday the place is so pretty and cute. Staff were friendly and we only waited 5 minutes to be seated as we didn't want to be by the window. We ordered freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee. The breakfast menu hasn't got much variety for those that don't like eggs like my boyfriend but we asked for a English breakfast muffin with bacon and no egg which they were happy to do. I had scrambled egg on toast. The portion sizes are tiny however some of the other breakfast options I saw other people order seemed to be more satisfying so if I go back I will be sure to add something more filling. Never the less it was a nice bite to eat in a cute place. Will try the fresh cakes next time, maybe afternoon tea or try the lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. One small slice of toast and scrambled egg. I asked for tomatoes on the side as it didn't come with anything else
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Orange juice and coffee at Muriel's kitchen

5pKYk8Tt7iyyopbZuVzAJA.text: I had liked Muriel's kitchen when I once had a juice at their Soho branch. The one in South Kensington doesn't have an equally amazing interior but I thought I'd go in for a healthy salad. Unfortunately service took forever and our salads were full of yummy stuff but there was no dressing whatsoever. I could have asked for oil and vinegar but didn't want to wait any longer. I might go again, try more food, and then give a better review.

rN1Mi5IfnaP8SwxAs1LEzQ.text: Arranging to meet a colleague in London's museum quarter, I tiredly stumble into the first place I come to, folksy new brunch and lunch place, Muriel's Kitchen.Named after some venture capitalist's grandmother (who obviously had a smart eye for a roll out and a chain concept). It's as British as only South Kensington can be, like a plastinated theme park recreation of a fictionalised remembrance of a bucolic rose tinted past. See also Irish pubs in airports and Michael Gove's education policy.The look goes for Farrow and Ball country kitchen, the menu farmer's market chic. If there's a limit to the number of times they can reference fresh and local and 'fun' I can't find it. It's been designed by a focus group consisting of the wives of Tory grandees and former prison guards.The staff are joyless and borderline scary as they contemplate table turn and space yield in a way that would impress the most ruthless of bankers. We're all crammed in closely and efficiently despite the space being less than half filled. I pitied the poor sods who followed after me and, unhappy with their allocated seating at the apex of two, cold windows attempted to move. "All of the chairs are assigned to a table... Please don't move them. No, no. Those tables are for four people only". This is 'fun'... with deliberate quotation marks.Despite that oh so jolly treatment, the food genuinely isn't that bad. My cheese omelette was borderline undercooked (in true French style) but fresh, light and creamy with a good hit of sharp cheese. The chutney alongside is just as I remember from my mother's WI days. Poached eggs are blisteringly golden, melting across acres of blushing toast that crunches with seedy goodness. Only anaemic coffee lets it down, I could be taking the line on parsimony too far but it tastes like the second time the beans have been used.It's generally a fine breakfast, with fine ingredients, albeit for a fairly 'fine' price. As it is removed we are upsold more tea, coffee or additional pasties. Declining, we are immediately presented with the bill and practically cleared with the table. Despite a decent breakfast, sometimes you remember why eating out is not just about the food...

7L04RZynqoyCsfwQmg_56w.text: Amazing macchiatos. They use illy coffee which probably explains why. The location is great. The atmosphere inside is warm and welcoming. Can get crowded, but that's part of its charm. The food is a bit pricey. A small portion of salmon puts you back a tenner. It's hardly filling and may need to be followed by another side. Nevertheless, the service is top quality. And that's really the most important part of any joint because, let's face it, we can cook a slab of salmon at home.

gM5plzqDfhPcU4SlcpFWYg.text: Cute enough place and right by the tube stop. I ordered an egg white omelette. Props for it not being oily, very sizable and tasty. Didn't come with toast, but I asked for some and they brought it out (not sure if they usually charge for this or not). My big beef with this place is it's a little slow and some of the servers seem out of it. Overall, a pretty good breakfast option in the area with you want table service.

x21ZzJWc9y4Al8pydwOrrg.text: Two words. Brownie and coffee. Mmmmm.Dulce de leche brownie and mocha coffee here are sublime. The brownie was so damn delicious and came with vanilla ice cream, they know how it's meant to be! My mocha coffee really surprised me with it's smoothness and a taste that somehow doesn't have that bitter aftertaste you usually can't get away from with most coffees. I like my coffee sweet and milky and may have only had bitter-free coffee like this one other time and I really think it's something special.I did also try the beef lasagne here, which my friend really liked but was too much meat and not enough taste for me. This place does have really crowded seating, but if I'm having coffee and brownies like that, I might not even notice from up on Cloud Nine.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Best coffee in London
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beef lasagne

JLpHDA0WCkFRvCKuG9vAmw.text: My family and I stayed nearby at the Ampersand Hotel and saw this cute restaurant near by. The first time my family and I went for dinner. We really enjoyed the food but the service was lacking. I received a glass of wine with several flies in it and it took forever to call a waitress over. The wine was replaced by the manager who was apologetic. The food was very nice, especially the lasagne. Later when the bill arrived we saw that we were overcharged and had to dispute the charges with the waitress. The manager eventually came over again and was very professional, helpful, and sorted out the bill. Later that week my sister and I returned since it was one of the first joy restaurants open late and had a different waiter originally who was very attentive and got us our food quickly. But his shift must have ended and the waitress from the other night came with the bill and once again attempted to over charge us. She claimed to have mistakenly read the bill wrong and reluctantly handed our change back when we showed her the correct amount on the bill. We were very irritated with her attitude and attempts to get a few more pounds out of us.

80vFL-RQOiU06JUxHXtJXw.text: This was the first spot we hit up upon arriving in London for our vacation, it was great.. we went back two more times during our stay. The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. Their scotch eggs, avocado toast, English breakfast, coffee, tea; it's all great!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. English Breakfast
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Scotch Eggs

SriE6X0xCyKl4vSC3GQamA.text: This place had people lining up outside the doors for Sunday breakfast. So naturally, being British, we saw a queue and we joined it! I'm glad we did too! The breakfast menu boasted a range of dishes, from full English to granola, and all the different eggs in between. I went for eggs Royal with extra avacado and cleaned my plate. It was excellent. There wasn't  a thing left on any of our plates, but we were set up for the day. My coffee was lovely and a few of the girls went for a healthy smoothy option (kale in the morning....each to their own!) and everything went down a treat. Very reasonably priced for South Kensington.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. 10/10
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

LR15QHAy5juANaWzhSsIzg.text: Muriel's Kitchen is awesome. Tucked around the corner of the entrance to the tube station I never knew it was there, but I won't miss it again. I was craving a nutritious lunch, I'm really trying to be good with what I eat, which is often difficult when eating out. Not at Muriel's Kitchen. I picked up a box of grilled salmon, with mushrooms, quinoa, leaves, peppers... Basically a box of delicious health!Next time I'm in South Ken, I'll definitely go back for lunch again.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Choices choices
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Bargain!
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Yum

XDf-dJx2p2p-oXQBblQGMg.text: It's really a shame that despite the nice food and atmosphere, that Muriel's seemingly cares little about how slow the service is. I mean, I get it... It's extremely busy most times of the day but it's not exactly like there's a whole lot of cooking that needs to be done. Many meals are simply popped in the microwave with most visits taking an hour, more or less. Today I had to show myself to a table because the waiter could not be bothered to do so. Maybe they're understaffed or just poorly staffed, but one thing is for certain, I'm not waiting an hour for microwaved food. Completely unacceptable. I likely won't be back, but it probably won't matter to anyone since I'm pretty sure they make more money on tourist traffic than they do retaining regulars. Sad state of affairs.

UtB7Tg_J-cZ1Nh091gWy_A.text: I had the veg curry and it was ok. My father had the burger and was unimpressed, the meat was dry. Otherwise, the salads were nice

pu_xk5WawyH5K1sd_QJdUA.text: We had the Blueberry Pancakes, bacon, pan au raisin, and the champions breakfast. All delicious! Great service and reasonable price. If you are staying in Kensington this is a great place for breakfast/brunch as they offer until 3pm.  We have another day here and are coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Patsy and Eddy are everywhere! Love it!
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry Pancakes, bacon, pan au raisin, and the champions breakfast. All delicious!  Reasonably priced with great service!

VpTEGq8TIjRQVodmcLJWrQ.text: Service was friendly but a bit slow, perhaps due to the lunch crowd. The place was also quite small and cramped and it was difficult to get to seats. Otherwise great drinks, though I did not have any food.

oKoCSavIszptVpZXzqvrzQ.text: She must have sold! It's no longer the same. Alcohol in the food display when you first come in and should've been our first clue that it no longer is something that your aunt would be serving. It's all about profitability now with the alcohol. The menu is completely different. All the desserts are completely different. The quality was very poor compared to what it used to be. I will not recommend this place nor will I go back there again very sad

qx_bqTp4lui7QpW4GSoHZA.text: I don't get the low ratings. Had a wonderful breakfast here - healthy,nutritious, and delicious! The wait staff was super friendly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

sL6vaw2CnaeiQtqy8V6Glw.text: For our second visit of Muriel's Kitchen, we had a wonderful time! The staff is adorable, the food excellent and the decoration lovely. We enjoyed our breakfast made of perfectly poched eggs, avocado toast, delicious smoothies and hot beverages (latte for him, green tea for me). We'll surely be back for our next trip in London!

9RzpExNoUU6z76rmynm-6w.text: Went here for brunch with my family and we were all impressed! Definitely recommend for a fun breakfast/brunch stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Posh for One

MTGR6w8P82y5wRM-UeUuVQ.text: Decor & atmosphere is cool & quirky. Definitely the kind of place you go to for a nice snack/coffee/cake. Service was also really good - waiters were friendly and attentive.We went for dinner so ordered the melted Camembert with crostini for a sharing starter - thumbs up for this indulgent plate especially if you love your cheese (although it's pretty hard to go wrong with baked Camembert).The mains however - really nothing special. The fish pie was tasteless and hard to even finish. The salmon was nothing I couldn't prepare better my self at home and came with a few salad leaves and chilli sauce. If you come here, best opt for the snackable dishes instead of forking out on the less than average mains.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Melted Camembert with Crostini - yum!

xZF76jGDDGgSwsBZQa-V-g.text: Great coffee. Greaaat pancakes. Great view. Great smoothies. Great service. Good price

Ah_JsKITTF5-ZSHqtqPyeg.text: Had grilled halloumi with roasted tomatoes and poached eggs. Food tasted good and I'm pleased that they served made me ice americano upon request although they didn't have it in their menu. Although it was busy, the staff settled us in as quickly as possible. Appreciated the warm sunshine shinning into the cafe :)

_8UTdSGmQZRzPB8dfVP8Og.text: They have great salads and food there is fresh! The place is very nice (a little hipster/trendy) but nice. Not sure if I think this place pricey or not but anyway it's really good! I had the Fish cake 9£, and it was delicious! I would definitely go back for more! The deice is a bit low but I wasn't in a hurry and the good thing is that even when they are busy they don't rush you out or anything I found it a pretty relaxing place to stay.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fish pie
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

gINLFSLFyi_EmWElK8C9RA.text: Not my cup of tea, no pun intended.Had the egg white omelette. I like my spinach a bit more cooked, but it, and the english muffin, were good.My problem is with the service. Not enough people for the small restaurant. You need to get there early in order to get a table and even then, the waiter was rushed.

tVjDeFdseWKRZesmEvR5dQ.text: Living in SoCal where fresh food is abundant, I was so delighted to find this wonderful restaurant!  I've enjoyed everything from the vegetarian dishes to meat lovers. All fantastic! We've been here for our last 3 meals!

bbv3B29b5oUIV0GsMMcA5g.text: Found this place by accident, and took a respite from the rain with some tea.  And, the best carrot cake on the planet.  Also went for breakfast a few days later---also very solid.

vTBmpjJbyeRlpofYUg_ocA.text: I just visited London last week and sadly did not make it to Muriel's until my last day! Friends had told me that it was a great brunch spot in Kensington.It was well worth the wait. We were seated within 15 minutes at about 10am on a Saturday. I ordered a latte and grapefruit gin drink--both were delicious. The latte was a bit smaller than expected but it was good. I ordered the Muriel Popeye: sourdough with a fried egg and bacon...did not get the baked beans but instead got a side of guacamole for an extra 3.50 which was well worth the extra pounds!My friend got the tumeric latte which had quite the kick to it & could've used some sugar. She also got the grilled halloumi and roasted tomato toast which she enjoyed. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Muriel's Popeye w side of guacamole

gjticCgGBZpi_n9Y6TyBbA.text: Good food, but very poor service.We specifically came to this location because of the good reviews. We patiently waited in line behind 3 other couples. Two ladies stood behind the couple behind us...they didn't have reservations and were audibly complaining to each other that they couldn't be bothered to wait in line for their coffee if they were going to make it to their following plans, so they went straight to the cash register and negotiated with the server to get a table straight away. And they got it. The waiter stood 2 feet away from the line of 10 people, no explanations to the rest of us who had been waiting 15-20 minutes. We found this absolutely rude. Nevertheless, we stayed in line and got seated about 10 minutes later. We were quickly asked if we wanted still or sparkling water... with no mention that it would be £4! No mention of the price on the menu either.Food was good, especially the cakey pancakes, but the whole experience was tarnished.

fn9iLzJeufSZVwVfTXdvew.text: Came here around 11am ordered the fried chicken sandwich with fries. Got seated quickly which I was expecting to wait since I read other reviews it gets very busy which it did as soon as we left. Anyways back to the food. The sandwich was very good tasted fresh & light fries were perfect. Food is a little over priced keep that in mind. I mean 2 chicken sandwiches with fries $40 dollars I think way too much. But overall food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

vyMTYVkXVsLhyHii-nRycA.text: Heard great reviews, just outside the station at South Kennsington. Needed to have a Full English with poached eggs. Eggs cooked nicely but some residual vinegar taste, Portobello mushroom delicious but now only going 1 instead of 2. Service ok.Note the butter croissant was terrible. A day old I think

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

lgXUjPQ4O-UW99dUQ8aluw.text: We came here for our first breakfast in London. It was packed for a Friday morning by our standards but we were squeezed in at a high counter after a 5 minute wait. Service was okay but what I really enjoyed was my fresh green juice and the food. We had a great time people watching and pigging out on a full English breakfast. I would definitely go back. Their dessert case looked so beautiful!

EnaFbM4JjPmhcqw8r-UJVQ.text: I'm giving this place 2 stars instead of one because in all fairness, the place is cute and the woman at the front seemed oblivious as to what happened to us.We walked in, after flying 11 hours and after doing a ton of research on nearby places to eat. I took my little girl here as a European vacation. I was raised in London and I haven't been back since I was a child.Two men greeted us when we entered and offered us a stool that was too tall for my child, so he gave us the option of a regular table and we took it. I had a weird feeling because a lot of time passed and both men kept looking over and we were clearly being ignored from that point on. We are American and I don't know if that had anything to do with it? Sadly, my roots are British and this was a poor example of their hospitality. About 30 minutes passed and still no drink order, not even water. I understand that European service is slow at times, so I was waiting patiently. But when people all around us that literally just walked in were getting drink orders and meal orders, I started feeling it was more than likely intentional, especially when our menus were clearly on the table and they had made eye contact several times. At that point, we opted to leave but informed the female at the front desk beforehand and she seemed thankfully concerned.Not a very good example of what a restaurant should exhibit in a place that is clearly central to a lot of tourists. We ate at Pappa Roma down the street instead. The food was exceptional and the service exemplary.As a side note, not all Americans voted for Trump. Not all Americans support the things that have been going on for quite some time. We are thinking people as well, with hearts just as deep.

brXxsygaAXXHx45pO-uaWA.text: I loved there   dishes I my self love the breakfast  meal  ,so if there is eggs I appreciate  it very highly. And they sirve  eggs untel 3 o'clock in the  afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Tc0fPEMXLM12gIAjpIoNig.text: Great food and a cute place, but for some reason they feel the need to pack it as full as they can and had us sit at a table which is literally right next to the toilet. Having people edge by you to go relieve themselves and the smells from the toilet kind of put a damper on an otherwise enjoyable avocado toastq. How about take away the table next to the toilet and instead put a shelf there with decorations to give people a bit of a buffer, and perhaps have drawers to store extra things. Would be a much better use and would also avoid negative yelp reviews such as this one.

CklfQ8y50gnIEnf_FFrwaA.text: I could eat here every week.  Well, frankly, I've been here four times in the last two weeks. The service is always fantastic. Even when they have been packed, they are attentive and with a smile, asking if everything is okay, asking if they can get you something else.  I highly suggest:chocolate croissantblueberry muffinpopeye breakfastfresh juicestomato roasted red pepper soupbaked haloumi with scrambled eggsThey have wifi and lots of seating. And every dish I have had there has been served with an attention to food quality and interesting flavors. I have one thing, that's just personal, which is that I love smashed avocados with eggs on toast. Their's is almost perfect. For the life of me I can't figure out why they'd drizzle honey over it. For me, eggs and toast and avocado are savory items. In California, this is a common dish, so opposite of sweet that we actually put flaked salt on it in large pieces.  The honey on this dish is so off-putting for me. I had to send it back.  They didn't offer another dish or to refund my meal because as the waitress said "it has honey listed on the menu."  True. It does. And it's gross.  But everything else is so perfect that I can't even fault them for what I think is an odd recipe. I'm still giving them five stars for their super friendly service, their great food, and their attention to quality. I want to try their milkshakes next!

pQHBaDv1DULHzF1KZqHmzQ.text: Breakfast was great! I got the toast with fried egg inside. My husband makes this for me, and this version is great! Awesome bread! They have vegetable/fruit juices and good coffee and great service. The manager was so nice, came by and apologized for the delay(we didn't even notice) and took care of our drinks. My son ate all his pancakes, they were so yummy! The ambience is nice, overlooks busy south Kensington.

AUvaGKJnKjbae8hE_qYrAg.text: I've always avoided this place because it's so incredibly crowded all the time, but I decided to give it a try as I was craving eggs benedict (my favourite breakfast) and crowded often means quality! I was lucky enough to snag a small table right away. The staff is busy busy busy but super friendly and courteous despite some of the appalling treatment from customers I witnessed.My order came out quickly, to my surprise. With an absolutely packed restaurant I expected quite the wait. The eggs benedict were quite good, not the best I've ever had but certainly in the top ten. My carrot ginger juice was way too gingery for my taste though. I asked them if I could get a less spicy version and they were very nice about it and made me a fresh one with less ginger. The food was okay overall, I'm giving a high rating for the service though! Especially in busy, popular places the service can really suffer, but this place has it down!

zv1LMCZbcSeFUG6frlMFTQ.text: We were looking for somewhere nice to have brunch before a day out at the V&A and the menu at Muriel's looked delightful. I had halloumi and baked tomatoes on toast, topped with perfect poached eggs. I added bacon on the side but the meal would have been equally delicious as a vegetarian option. My partner had the full English breakfast and gave a glowing review of the eggs. They use organic eggs and you can taste the difference. To drink I had a carrot and ginger smoothie which I thoroughly enjoyed and a coconut latte after my meal. I'm a huge fan of all things coconut and the latte was thoroughly delicious. We will definitely be back, especially on seeing how good the lunch and dinner menus look. The best thing is that all the prices are rather reasonable for the area.

f7V-UttLpILCM5_jTsi_nQ.text: Orange juice was fresh squeezed and the best one I've had during my euro trip. I had the Benedict and it was great (like all other benedicts)

7Czhs_-40RJFA0sqmMkCsA.text: We were visiting the natural history museum for which Muriel's is super convenient. We had children with us and they accommodated the kids without batting an eyelid but note there isn't a dedicated kids menu. But extra plates etc were no problem and the food style was very kid compatible.  It was a very friendly atmosphere, the service was good and the food extremely tasty. It was nice as a family to eat somewhere that wasn't prezzo, pizza express etc etc. Good range of drinks, fantastic cakes, tasty mains that were well made; we will definitely use Muriel's again if we are visiting this bit of London.

AnKehI-kMqB_R0tsFM8byw.text: Absolutely great across the board - drinks (fresh squeezed juice), food (lasagna and shepherds pie -wow), decor, and general vibe.  The only place we ate twice at the entire week in London.  A must go if you are visiting the museums.

1X9d7AVwwwfJN9MydgfUwQ.text: Remarkable late lunch near the V&A and Nat History Museums. Attentive friendly staff, fabulous meal. Don't overlook the sweet potato chick pea curry, and the avocado & salmon on toast! Cute decor with made to order coffees and smoothies. Loved it.

g4prqnenFooq_TfKAJs-JQ.text: Yum! Straight off our flight from America we stopped in to Muriel's for a proper British breakfast. I was excited to have fresh juice, and I ordered the   Jam and bread selection. The restaurant is decorated cute & quaint, open, airy, & filled with light. Like a slice of the countryside dropped in South Ken.  It was a delightful breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

OSkZLlU64Zd_WrcvA5ohBw.text: This little restaurant has been around for a while, but it's always been quite busy. Lately, I've seen new branches pop up around London, Richmond, Soho and Leicester Square. So per chance I was going to be in South Kensington early this morning so decided to pay it visit before the restaurant filled up!The first thing you notice is that the decor is homey and quirky. The upside-down colander light shades, the upside down pot plants all contribute to a loving and comfortable atmosphere. The breakfast is good, the sausages were awesome but the toast not so much. After my breakfast I spent most of my time eyeing other people's breakfast, in particular the Muriel's Breakfast Sandwich and the Blueberry Pancakes looked delicious so I might have had a teeny bit of food envy!Last but not least... I loved the plates, they should probably consider selling 'em!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

ynqaSAP4e9MM5RwL34eoUw.text: Reading all the other reviews, I'm bummed we didn't get the chance to try breakfast. We did, however, have dinner and let me tell you, we could not have been more satisfied with concluding our UK trip by having our last meal here. We still think about it because that's how much we enjoyed it!The flattened British sirloin steak was delicious, perfectly cooked and well seasoned. I only got a bite of it since my boyfriend seemed to enjoy it too much to share. I got the spicy chipotle beef & pork meatballs, which was equally delicious. Everything just worked. The rice complemented the meatballs so well, I cleaned the plate. In regards to the space, it was a bit small and tight. The guest sitting perpendicular to me would occasionally bump into me. To her defense, she was in no better position than myself in terms of space, so I didn't really mind.  Lastly, the service. We experienced great service throughout our entire meal. The waiter, whose name I do not know or remember, was so lovely. He was very helpful in assisting us, especially me, with our meal choices. I could sense that he was very busy waiting on many full tables but he always came around at the perfect time to check up on us and make sure we were happy with our dishes. That does not happen often.I will be back here again the next time I'm back in London to try their breakfast, beef lasagna and their carrot cake!

AT0wUFqf6QO4y8_1-VMt_Q.text: We came here was because of the great reviews, but we were absolutely astonished by the horrific server we had. Majlinda took about 15 minutes to take our order and then promptly FORGOT to place it into the system. We waited an additional 20 minutes before we noticed the table next to us who was seated and ordered after us received their food. Then, the other server who was not even responsible for us noticed we had been sitting there so long there was no way we hadn't received our food yet. Cue an apologetic Majlinda who tried to make it right by bringing us a some water and complementary coffee. However, we were shocked to find we were charged £4 for that water and we only received it shortly before we had finished our food. When we brought this up to her, she told us that we had to learn and we should have specified tap water before she brought it. I have never received such condescending attitude from a service professional, let alone one that is so terrible at their job. However, the food and other staff were great, which is why I didn't leave a one star review.

3upRblytfZGm-vKAeB6aAg.text: Muriel's is a mini-chain of British bistros perfect for brunch. The South Kensington location is right next to a Tube stop and within spitting distance of the museums, making this an easy stop for tourists looking to grab an avocado toast during siteseeing.My boyfriend and I stopped in for bite in the late morning on a weekday, and we were lucky to grab a seat as it was quite busy. Seating is tight and, despite the light and airy decor, it can feel a bit stressful as the servers bustle around trying to keep the hordes happy.I had avocado toast with sunny side up eggs (9.50 pounds), which had a disappointingly thin layer of avocado but was otherwise good and filling, with nice runny yolks. My boyfriend did the Muriel's Popeyes with sausage (11.50 pounds), which is basically egg-in-a-hole with the beans and meat components of an English breakfast. Good stuff, huge portion.We rounded this off with a good cappuccino (around 3 pounds), though we weren't able to flag down a waiter to get water. It's a cute spot and the prices aren't awful. I'd consider tacking this on to plans if in the area, but I'd look into other restaurants if you're looking for a more relaxed brunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Muriel's Popeyes with sausages
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast with eggs

5oxGj64bCb_hl3doPidJzw.text: This place has everything it needs to be great and then spoils it.The decor is nice, the staff are friendly.  Although when I first came in, it was through gritted teeth and a bit forced. This was probably as he felt uncomfortable, with what he was about to do.I came for just a coffee and asked if that was okay. It was so I ordered. Then when I go to the seating. I am then forced to sit on a high bench in the window, in the direct sunglight.  I am not allowed to disagree. Meanwhile half of the many tables with normal seating arw empty.  It is not lunchtime, so it is not so full.  I respect that coming just for coffee is lower value than a full meal.  However they told me of the seating issue only after I had ordered the coffee and was going to the seating.  It bills itself as a cafe as well as restaurant, so I should go to another cafe or coffee shop, where I can sit in normal parts of the place.The coffee is undoubtably very good quality and that is worth paying for. However it is a small serving.As a result of the seating, I will probably go elsewhere next time and without that I would have come back to try it for food.  Sadly my long term goodwill has been eroded.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Sddj4pcwfH4us_511_j45A.text: The food is delish The service was very generousI am gratefulThe maitre de was super kindI went 3 d in a row

9HOapKkRN07dHhQxQw6mUw.text: I recently moved to London and ate breakfast at Muriel's Kitchen because it is close to my new home. I ordered the Eggs Royale with orange juice. It was extremely tasty  and I'd definitely recommend it! The smoked salmon was fresh and not salty or overbearing. The orange juice was freshly squeezed. They have an entire juice and smoothie bar which I highly recommend. We also tried their famous carrot cake which was delicious and covered in walnuts. It was great! I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast and brunch!

R2dHlXmwz_fVFSeyHX9_cw.text: This was my second time here while staying in the Chelsea area. I ordered their bacon and egg brioche but you should order their egg Benedict. It tastes amazing with the salmon and the perfect poached egg they lay over the brioche bread. Their OJ is so fresh that I ordered it both times. Boyfriend ordered their berry smoothie and charcoal latte the second time. He said the smoothie was alright but the latte was smooth. The service both times were amazing. Weekends are definitely busy so give them a break if they're not tending to you as much. Overall, great experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

wTALObElq97q4KXMigmzWA.text: nice people, good foodwe had a very enjoyable brunch here before heading out to museums. avocado toast and grilled halloumi/roast tomato toast: both very good. drinks ditto. a good experience all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. that's the avocado toast with poached egg

7PHyqkEkd1F6m48gPyssaw.text: Great food and great atmosphere! Love the vitamin mug juice! Their Lasagne is delicious as well as their eggs royale!!! Nice place in Kensington!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

pBEvLcLngHKVjCCDaoHmCg.text: We came on a busy Sunday afternoon after plans fell through for other english breakfast options. This restaurant is beautifully decorated. It's bright, quirky and the plant additions were a nice touch. The menu selection was pretty good. I had the fish pie...it was surprised at how good it was. Not fishy at all and the mashed potatoes made an excellent companion. The service was okay. Some servers were more attentive than others. Drinks were quite expensive and not a whole lot of coffee options. Would absolutely come back to try other menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

rl5q-kPgk3QBZTGQs55Aqg.text: My review is not the restaurants fault, bad luck on my part i guess? Strike 1: We arrived just before 11am noticing three tables were empty taking which accounted for aproximately 25% of the total seating. The host said someone had reserved 12 places. We sat at a counter facing outside, which wasn't bad if you like to people watch. Strike 2: I ordered an English breakfast light and was told they stop serving the light version at 10am, but serve the full English Breakfast all day(?). I was kind of disappointed so I ordered Grilled Halloumi and Roasted Tomatoes( I couldn't eat the tomatoes, the cheese was chewy) I ate the egg and toast leaving hungry. My family seemed to like their dishes

8pHg9qmlAUGKlj9VwOz5mg.text: I walked over here for breakfast and was very happy with my meal. I simply ordered the brioche bun with egg+bacon. My bacon was crispy just the way I like it - they also use Organic Clarence eggs - the runny yolk was perfect! I asked for water not knowing I'd get a bottle of water - for visitors make sure you ask for tap! My americano was amazing and prices were fair - I'd like to come back to check out thei lunch menu. Unfortunately, they no longer serve Scotch Eggs :(

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

GdHVWGud5RBMzVhnLSJlTw.text: Yummy! My husband and I keep going back to Muriel's. The food is fantastic. I recommend everything we've tried so far: Full English breakfast, Muriel's Popeyes, Smoked Salmon Benedict, soup of the day, fried chicken sandwich, lasagna, carrot cake, and Nutella chocolate cake. All delicious!

0kmol-U07HHzqhlIT95RMA.text: Cute breakfast spot in Chelsea. A lot of different options, avocado toast, pressed juices, traditional breakfast and more. I got the avocado toast on sour bread and scrambled eggs and it was hearty and had great flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Activated charcoal latte with almond milk

1XFxR9tDiSoWsflOWlK-GA.text: My first breakfast in London & so incredible. They have the cutest plates and place their food so beautifully! Elegant and adorable :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Aa-eNg4tK0cKQcbV_gDP2Q.text: Great service, delicious food, decor is cozy, hip and inviting. A real neighborhood gem!

PoG9x1Bqsdh1OTuWEoUJYw.text: Came here with a friend and the hostess told us to wait 10 mins for a table. Two other people walked in behind us and they were told to wait 10-15 mins but then were seated before us (maybe because they were white and I'm not, pretty racist if you ask me). Finally after realizing we noticed what she did, she told us there was a "small table available and by the bathroom." By then we just wanted to be seated and eat since we were in a rush so we took the "only" available table. Service was mediocre.  I got the Buddha bowl which was decent, my friend got the English breakfast which was just ok-nothing special. I wouldn't go back, especially after this initial unwelcoming experience and definitely not worth my time or money.

dmZzLSFQtZcmO1BL7uJ4KA.text: This place is really, really good!  Food prep is excellent, the choices are unique and wonderful. The avocado toast/eggs was prepared well, and presented very appealing.  The coffee was the best we had in the Kensington area, get some!  My wife had a nice biscuit with some delicious jam, and she liked it a lot.  Best breakfast we had in our London vacation, then hopped on the Tube, 50 yards away.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast coffee...americano, steamed milk

sx6Owhs9mg8GgH72Y1oSJA.text: This is one of the best places I went to for breakfast The Buddha dish is just stunning delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

jrGLd_bzofEaQ0xs8hmFug.text: Wow! Incredible brunch at 11:00am on a Sunday. We ordered Eggs Royals. TO DIE FOR! Great fresh squeezed orange juice. We will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

B01HRYYVRgYPM8Gc_ITs7A.text: LOVED the Brunch here! Major Breakfast person but the line was odd, cant make reservations but at least the Bakery was right next to the line so we ordered while waiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

eEOK6Xl0I4wOnj9gpxomsQ.text: Super cute cafe with great food! I had the Buddha Bowl with the jalapeño sauce and it was awesome! Packed with protein the quinoa, avocados, edamame, veggies and eggs just blend together beautifully! Much more flavorful than your typical English breakfast. My hubs had pancakes and enjoyed them. I would definitely come here again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Buddha bowl
Photo of Muriel's Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes

Pnd1j6bBx4pCyBADWXlwqg.text: We came here after visiting The Royal Marsden Hospital.  We were originally going to eat somewhere in Hammersmith but changed our minds after seeing this corner shop.  This place was packed when we got there but luckily we were able to get a table within 3 minutes of showing up.  We ordered the eggs Florentine and peanut butter French brioche.  Out of the 2 dishes, I preferred the eggs Florentine.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  Cutting into the egg, the yolk ran over the English muffin.  The hollandaise sauce was excellent as well.  Not sour at all.  The peanut butter French Brioche looked good on the menu and when it came to the table but while I was eating it, it struck me that I was eating a peanut butter and jelly sandwich deconstructed.  The strawberry jam and peanut butter each came in their own small bowels and the bread was the toasted brioche.  The waitress told me it was like French toast.  In my mind, I thought it was the French toast from the states.  I guess their definition in London is different.  Either way, the dish did taste good.  The jam wasn't overly sweet and the peanut butter was a little crunchy.  They didn't use the type of peanut better where the oil was separated.  The brioche was nicely toasted, not burnt, and there was some brown sugar sprinkled on top of the brioche.

LhCdBFNcYb8-8WI6phYqjQ.text: The food here looks great, although I've only tied one of the cupcakes. The cupcake was chocolate orange and was delicious for the first few bites, but the sweetness was a bit overwhelming. I felt a bit ill afterwards. I think it would be better if they came in smaller portions! They are a bit expensive and the people at the counter kind of ignored us for awhile. Overall I'd probably go back there but they're not as good as I'd hoped.

Qj3dh4nUw1hphBkcEt9JlQ.text: This place is located right outside of South Kensington tube station so I like to pop in here on my way to work and grab a breakfast english muffin sandwich and a cappuccino. I'm picky about my cappuccinos and find that most places simply do not make them properly, but Muriel's does and I am grateful for that. I usually get the egg and bacon english muffin sandwich- the egg is so warm and fluffy. It makes such a stand out difference from other places because their food is made fresh on the premises and you can taste that in every dish. I've had their chicken pot pie, which hits the spot- the chicken is made with dark flavorful meat and the pie is perfectly flaky. It's quite cozy for being a busy cafe next to a tube station, but it's well decorated and a lot of thought has gone into making the place feel like a country home kitchen right in the middle of London. Although the other reviews are upset about the service, and I agree it can be slow and inefficient at times, but honestly this is my experience at basically every cafe I've been to in London and I find the staff here to be very sweet and the management really puts effort and love into what they do, and that is what matters to me. I don't care if I have to wait a bit for service because the product is good and once a server does come around, they are nothing but kind.

UvTkjXzE-98aeV3iYzp0OQ.text: We enjoyed our breakfast. The place was very crowded, and while we did not have a long wait on a Saturday morning we were very close to the next table. The service could have been faster, and they forgot our coffees, but when we asked about the coffees they quickly appeared and we were not charged for them. Overall certainly would go back.

jZGIIxsvxWkac1wB2PwWvg.text: All we had here was a cup of peppermint tea on a very cold early spring day but service couldn't have been better, tea was excellent, & wifi was a bonus. Great place to regroup after long day of sightseeing.

oL1bb7pV9FAoGctrHow0fA.text: I really, really wanted to like this restaurant.  Standalone, easy dining, brunch places are few and far between. In the UK, chain restaurants rule. The decor is great, bright, cheerful and country-twee: Just the sort of place you'd want to have brunch in on a sunny Saturday. The brunch menu is full of solid choices like eggs benedict/florentine/royale, English muffins with scrambled eggs and bacon, full English, eggs on toast, boiled eggs and asparagus spears.  The ingredients are well-sourced and good.  It is even priced fairly for the location (in theory, anyway, see following) with the eggs benny at £7 and full English at £7.50.  The full English is good value for what you get: sausage, two rashers bacon, beans, black pudding, tomato, toast and eggs. Properly abundant.  In stark contrast, however, the eggs benedict (at only 50p cheaper) was a split muffin with one thin slice of ham draped forlornly over both muffin sides, a poached egg on each and a teaspoon of hollandaise plopped on the top of each. Save to say my boyfriend tucked into half my full English to supplement his meal.  The freshly squeezed OJ was indeed freshly squeezed (as opposed to freshly squeezed out of a carton, which is what a lot of restaurants do) and the cappuccini good enough.  As one reviewer already pointed out: no soy milk available, which is a gross oversight in this day and age.  A warning: if you like your proper Heinz tommy K and HP you'll be in for a disappointment as they only have chichi wilkes&sons ketchup and brown sauce -- passable but why mess with a good thing, I ask??  So all in all the food was pretty good.  Oh, but the service...WHAT SERVICE!?  Servers running all over the place like headless chickens, each 'assigned' sections even though the restaurant is the size of my living room.  We more-or-less seated ourselves and waited... And waited... And waited.  Eventually, a server gave us menus.   When we were ready we summoned her again but she said, "Oh, I'll just get your server." Eh?  So we ordered from OUR server.  Drinks were served fairly promptly.  The diner next to me got her eggs royale: along with guest hair. The lady complained to the server that she had asked for hollandaise on the side (in my head I was thinking:  Lady, you got bigger problems than that) and the server told her that if she wanted that she'd have to wait another fifteen minutes; she declined.  I digress.  When my boyfriend's and my food arrived I asked the (different again) server for brown sauce. "Brown?" "yes, brown sauce" "brown...brown sugar?" "no sauce, brown sauce... BROWN SAUCE" "ok, I ask." We got our sauces in the end -- see above. The frustration of the diners was palpable.  As I wrote at the beginning of this review: I really want to love this place.  I really do......But I don't.  The owner, Ms Noble, seriously needs to sort her management out because they are not doing this place justice.  Too many schoolboy (or girl, lets not be sexist here) errors. The staff ought to have a basic command of the English language and they need to get organised (and not eat in behind the deli counter in full view of customers).  I also note that there is no address on their website.  What a rudimentary oversight.Yeah, and they need to wear hairnets or something in the kitchen.  Maybe I should've pointed the hair out to my adjacent diner, as act of good citizenship.  It's been weighing upon my mind all day...

ME2NFpjY8rNy7ZRldzMJ7g.text: Good food at a good price! The veggie sides are to die for. After traveling for 3 weeks, we really needed a proper veggie fix besides salads. This place has cooked veggies in spades! Roasted beets, broccoli w/garlic, roasted butternut squash, fresh string beans... Yum!

7QcGxWsKVHQ4LQgZFl7DMg.text: A friend and I were looking for a place to grab a drink and possibly a bite, after visiting the museum and thought this place looked cute from the outside.  That's really the nicest thing I can say about it.  I have never written a review, but had such a poor experience here, I felt compelled to do so.  We each ordered one glass of wine - one white and one red.  After ordering, we were told that we had to order food or leave!?  Ok, I understand if it has something to do with the type of liquor license they have, but you should tell people that BEFORE ordering.  Anyway, we ordered the chips and said no big deal.  When our wine arrived, we were given two glasses of white.  After returning one to a confused server and finally getting a glass of red, the chips arrived - 7 of them on a plate - soggy and wilted.  I took one bite and couldn't eat any more.  They looked like they were microwaved!  When the server came back, I asked if they were, and he said yes, they were microwaved?!  Who does that at home, let alone at a restaurant and then charges £5?  We sent them back and I kid you not, another plate of wilted, soggy chips arrived not 3 minutes later.  Again, I asked if they were microwaved chips and again, the server said yes.  We gave up and ordered chocolate cake instead.  The cake was ok and definitely better than soggy chips heated in a microwave. Oh, and when the check came, the chips were still on it!Overall, if you want over-priced, microwaved food, with poor service, then have at it, but I would never come here again.

EdrA3FqhH0Em507W2czrtg.text: We came here for brunch on a weekday and the food was fantastic.  I ordered the English breakfast and Fatty was happy: 2 sausages, bacon, black pudding, beans, tomatoes, toast and 2 eggs.  I'm sure my cholesterol went up by 1000 points after that meal, but I'm still dreaming about it!  My wife and son were equally as happy with their orders.  The decor is very cute and inviting.  The service was okay (not prompt, but not terribly slow) and not as horrific as others have posted about.  However, the place was half full when we arrived.  So perhaps, Muriel's Kitchen is a great place for brunch - serving great food when there isn't such a big crowd.

pK20Dhmf44tKUyPClCKipA.text: The service was quick even if it was 1 o'clock in the afternoon. The juices are pretty good !

Zsq3ch_XMa3dASQR17KGjA.text: This adorable looking cost restaurant has a lively atmosphere and nice staff.  I was happy to see a vegetable cobbler and quinoa salad. Then I saw the microwave and sevond guessed my decision to eat there but was so hungry I put my hesitation aside. My delight dwindled further when I heard the vegetables were coated in double cream. I ordered the minestrone soup and quinoa salad. The soup was just ok, certainly no better than eating the tinned version. The quinoa salad had no dressing or flavour whatsoever. Luckily they had Tabasco which went someway towards making it edible.
